_header: In the day of fast and spiritual affliction
Title(s): ’Balat set upponne the yates of Caunterbury’
Subjects: Canterbury, city of; political poems; chronicles, verse in; Henry VI, verses against
_description: ’Balat set upponne the yates of Caunterbury’ inserted in a prose chronicle (ante 1471) — ten 8-line macaronic stanzas (ababbcbc) and concluding 6-line stanza (aabccb)

BodLye34.First Lines:
In the day of faste and spirituell afflixiounThe celestiall
                    influence of bodyes transytory…
BodLye34.Last Lines:
…Sone to louse from sorowes bondBe ryght indifferent
                    iugement
BodLye34.Attributed Title: Balat set vppon the yates of Canterbury (f. 203)
